#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=By Dicky

#Text=‘ Well , Annie , I have bad news for you , ’ said Mr Ridgway , as he entered the comfortable dining-room of his cabin in the Bush . ‘ Sam Redfern the Bushranger is about this part of the Bush just now .
#Text=I hope he will not attack us with his gang .
#Text=’
#Text=‘ I hope not , ’ responded Annie , a gentle maiden of some sixteen summers .
#Text=Just then came a knock at the door of the hut , and a gruff voice asked them to open the door .
#Text=‘ It is Sam Redfern the Bushranger , father , ’ said the girl .
#Text=‘ The same , ’ responded the voice , and the next moment the hall door was smashed in , and Sam Redfern sprang in , followed by his gang .
#Text=-- -- -- CHAPTER II
#Text=Annie ’s Father was at once overpowered , and Annie herself lay bound with cords on the drawing-room sofa .
#Text=Sam Redfern set a guard round the lonely hut , and all human aid was despaired of .
#Text=But you never know .
#Text=Far away in the Bush a different scene was being enacted .
#Text=‘ Must be Injuns , ’ said a tall man to himself as he pushed his way through the brushwood .
#Text=It was Jim Carlton , the celebrated detective . ‘ I know them , ’ he added ; ‘ they are Apaches . ’ just then ten Indians in full war-paint appeared .

#Text=Carlton raised his rifle and fired , and slinging their scalps on his arm he hastened towards the humble log hut where resided his affianced bride , Annie Ridgway , sometimes known as the Flower of the Bush .
#Text=-- -- -- CHAPTER III
#Text=The moon was low on the horizon , and Sam Redfern was seated at a drinking bout with some of his boon companions .
#Text=They had rifled the cellars of the hut , and the rich wines flowed like water in the golden goblets of Mr Ridgway .
#Text=But Annie had made friends with one of the gang , a noble , good-hearted man who had joined Sam Redfern by mistake , and she had told him to go and get the police as quickly as possible .
#Text=‘ Ha ! ha ! ’ cried Redfern , ‘ now I am enjoying myself ! ’
#Text=He little knew that his doom was near upon him .
#Text=Just then Annie gave a piercing scream , and Sam Redfern got up , seizing his revolver .
#Text=‘ Who are you ? ’ he cried , as a man entered .
#Text=‘ I am Jim Carlton , the celebrated detective , ’ said the new arrival .

#Text=Sam Redfern ’s revolver dropped from his nerveless fingers , but the next moment he had sprung upon the detective with the well-known activity of the mountain sheep , and Annie shrieked , for she had grown to love the rough Bushranger .
#Text=( To be continued at the end of the paper if there is room . )
#Text=-- -- -- SCHOLASTIC
#Text=A new slate is horrid till it is washed in milk .
#Text=I like the green spots on them to draw patterns round .
#Text=I know a good way to make a slate-pencil squeak , but I wo n’t put it in because I do n’t want to make it common .
#Text=-- SUB-EDITOR .
#Text=Peppermint is a great help with arithmetic .
#Text=The boy who was second in the Oxford Local always did it .
#Text=He gave me two .
#Text=The examiner said to him , ‘ Are you eating peppermints ? ’ And he said , ‘ No , Sir . ’
#Text=He told me afterwards it was quite true , because he was only sucking one .
#Text=I ’m glad I was n’t asked .
#Text=I should never have thought of that , and I could have had to say ‘ Yes . ’ -- OSWALD .
#Text=THE WRECK OF THE ‘ MALABAR ’
#Text=By Noel
#Text=( Author of ‘ A Dream of Ancient Ancestors . ’ ) He is n’t really -- but he put it in to make it seem more real .
#Text=Hark !
#Text=what is that noise of rolling Waves and thunder in the air ? ‘ Tis the death-knell of the sailors And officers and passengers of the good ship Malabar .
#Text=It was a fair and lovely noon When the good ship put out of port
#Text=And people said ‘ ah little we think How soon she will be the elements ’ sport . ’
#Text=She was indeed a lovely sight Upon the billows with sails spread .
#Text=But the captain folded his gloomy arms , Ah -- if she had been a life-boat instead !
#Text=See the captain stern yet gloomy Flings his son upon a rock , Hoping that there his darling boy May escape the wreck .
#Text=Alas in vain the loud winds roared And nobody was saved .
#Text=That was the wreck of the Malabar , Then let us toll for the brave . NOEL .
#Text=-- -- -- GARDENING NOTES
#Text=It is useless to plant cherry-stones in the hope of eating the fruit , because they do n’t !
#Text=Alice wo n’t lend her gardening tools again , because the last time Noel left them out in the rain , and I do n’t like it .
#Text=He said he did n’t .
#Text=-- -- -- SEEDS AND BULBS
#Text=These are useful to play at shop with , until you are ready .
#Text=Not at dinner-parties , for they will not grow unless uncooked .
#Text=Potatoes are not grown with seed , but with chopped-up potatoes .
#Text=Apple trees are grown from twigs , which is less wasteful .
#Text=Oak trees come from acorns .
#Text=Every one knows this .

#Text=When Noel says he could grow one from a peach stone wrapped up in oak leaves , he shows that he knows nothing about gardening but marigolds , and when I passed by his garden I thought they seemed just like weeds now the flowers have been picked .
#Text=A boy once dared me to eat a bulb .
#Text=Dogs are very industrious and fond of gardening .
#Text=Pincher is always planting bones , but they never grow up .
#Text=There could n’t be a bone tree .
#Text=I think this is what makes him bark so unhappily at night .
#Text=He has never tried planting dog-biscuit , but he is fonder of bones , and perhaps he wants to be quite sure about them first .
